events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection involving another vehicle. The incident caused substantial front-end damage to the insured's car.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident following a review of the incident details and keywords related to vehicle collision and damage.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to the case to ensure a smooth process and provide personalized assistance for this car accident case.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the customer's claim regarding the vehicle accident on the designated date.
The claim handler requested police accident reports, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The insured submitted all required documentation including the police report, photos of the collision damage, and garage repair quotes.
The claims investigation team began their review of the submitted evidence and contacted involved parties to verify details of the vehicle accident.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and all documentation aligns with the account of the car collision.
A settlement offer covering full repair costs was proposed to the customer based on the damages assessed and policy coverage.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the auto accident claim and the clarity of the settlement terms.
The insurance claim was approved following acceptance of the proposed settlement, confirming full coverage for the vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued promptly to the repair shop as per the agreed settlement to cover the insured vehicle's collision damage.
Following payment disbursement and confirmation of repair completion, the claim file was officially closed by the insurer.
The completed claim documentation and correspondence were archived for future reference and audit purposes in compliance with policy.
